supporting_quotes: In her first years in office, Johnson Sirleaf negotiated the lifting of international trade sanctions against Liberia and complete forgiveness of the country’s crushing external debt.
By executive order, Johnson Sirleaf established a right to free, universal elementary education.
President Johnson Sirleaf also enforced equal rights for women, rights that were routinely ignored and abused during the chaotic years of civil war.

raw_extractions.description: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf discusses her strategy during the presidential runoff election, including door-to-door campaigning and engaging university students.

raw_extractions.description: Implementing the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative to ensure accountability and transparency in resource management, including mines and forestry.
supporting_quotes: That’s just ensuring that the resources that come from our mines are properly accounted for, properly used, with the public being fully informed on what those resources are and where those resources are applied, show the proper budgetary process and whatnot.

We also asked the companies involved to participate, so that they can give the information directly to the watchdog group, and we willingly joined it, because it helps us to make our commitment to accountability and transparency.

raw_extractions.description: Addressing the challenges of young people affected by war through education, skills training, and job creation.
supporting_quotes: We did complete what is called a DDR — or Demobilization Disarmament Reintegration program — of over 100,000 of them. But still, getting them into school, getting them skills, getting them jobs, is still an ongoing process and still a challenge.
I think it’s a combination of many things. For one thing, we have to give these kids some skills. We have to give them back their dignity.

raw_extractions.description: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf discusses her efforts to address rape and enforce laws during her presidency.
supporting_quotes: Since assuming the presidency, you’ve also dealt with the issue of rape.

raw_extractions.description: Managed the West African Ebola outbreak, declared a national state of emergency, and implemented measures to contain the virus.
supporting_quotes: During the West African Ebola outbreak between 2014 and 2016, the President of Liberia, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, played a central role in managing the crisis.

In August 2014, Johnson Sirleaf declared a national state of emergency, implementing measures such as border closures, restrictions on movement, and quarantines in highly affected areas to contain the spread of the virus.

She formally requested assistance from the United States, which facilitated the U.S. military intervention to build treatment centers and provide logistical support.
raw_extractions.raw_llm_output:
```json
{
  "events": [
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Managed the West African Ebola outbreak, declared a national state of emergency, and implemented measures to contain the virus.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "During the West African Ebola outbreak between 2014 and 2016, the President of Liberia, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, played a central role in managing the crisis.",
        "In August 2014, Johnson Sirleaf declared a national state of emergency, implementing measures such as border closures, restrictions on movement, and quarantines in highly affected areas to contain the spread of the virus."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Established a national incident management system and a Presidential Advisory Committee on Ebola to coordinate the response.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Domestically, her government pushed for the creation of a national incident management system to coordinate the response between the Ministry of Health, United Nations agencies, and non-governmental organizations.",
        "She also established the Presidential Advisory Committee on Ebola, tasked with overseeing strategic actions and ensuring coherence in the work of partners on the ground."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "International",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Requested international assistance, particularly from the United States, to address the Ebola crisis.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "At the international level, Johnson Sirleaf became one of the most prominent voices drawing attention to the magnitude of the crisis.",
        "She formally requested assistance from the United States, which facilitated the U.S. military intervention to build treatment centers and provide logistical support."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Author",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "2010",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Released her first book, 'This Child Will Be Great: Memoir of a Remarkable Life by Africa's First Woman President'.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "In 2010, Sirleaf released her first book, This Child Will Be Great: Memoir of a Remarkable Life by Africa's First Woman President."
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

raw_extractions.description: Africa’s first democratically elected female head of state, leading Liberia through reconciliation and recovery after the civil war and Ebola crisis.
supporting_quotes: She was elected President of the Republic of Liberia in 2005, two years after the nation’s bloody civil war ended. Her historic inauguration as Africa’s first democratically elected head of state took place on January 16, 2006.
During her two terms as President, she focused on rebuilding the country, mobilizing over $16 billion in foreign direct investment.

raw_extractions.role: Co-Chair of the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda
raw_extractions.description: Tasked with crafting a roadmap for global recovery and Sustainable Development Goals.
supporting_quotes: In May 2012, she was appointed Co-Chair of the United Nations Secretary-General’s High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda, which was tasked with crafting a roadmap for global recovery and Sustainable Development Goals.

raw_extractions.description: First elected female president in Africa, leading Liberia through reconciliation and healing from civil war and the Ebola crisis.
supporting_quotes: She was purposively chosen for her contributions in Liberia towards democratic rule, women empowerment, and economic and social development (ACET, 2022).

Johnson-Sirleaf navigated a complex political landscape to be the first elected female president in Africa and led Liberia through reconciliation and healing from a decade of civil war and the Ebola crisis (Cook, 2018; Dennis, 2006).

raw_extractions.description: Center associated with Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, focusing on women and development.
supporting_quotes: To this effect, we sent a consent form to the Ellen Johnson Sirleaf Presidential Centre for Women and Development; however, no response was received.

  "events": [
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "Liberia",

      "end_date": "2017",
      "description": "Elected as Africa's first female head of state, focused on ending corruption, establishing unity, and rebuilding infrastructure.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "She was elected President in 2005, vowing to end corruption, establish unity, and rebuild Liberia’s devastated infrastructure.",
        "As President, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf immediately sought debt amelioration and the lifting of trade sanctions from the international community."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Transitional Government of Liberia",
      "role": "Chair of the Governance Reform Commission",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Played an active role in preparing the country for its first democratic elections after the civil war.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Upon her return to Liberia, she played an active role in the Transitional Government as the country recovered from the civil war and she chaired the Governance Reform Commission of the Transitional Government that was instrumental in preparing the country for its first democratic elections."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Advocate for inclusive healthcare",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "2017",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Became an advocate for community health workers and free primary healthcare after stepping down as President.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Since stepping down as President, and building on lessons learned during the Ebola epidemic, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf has become a staunch advocate for community health workers and free primary healthcare as a means to protect against the spreading of infectious diseases."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Nobel Peace Prize Laureate",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "2011",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for contributions to peace, economic and social development, and women's rights in Liberia.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "In 2011, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, alongside women’s rights campaigners Leymah Gbowee of Liberia and Tawakkul Karman of Yemen. She was awarded the prize for her contribution to ‘securing peace in Liberia, to promoting economic and social development, and to strengthening the position of women’."
      ]
    },
    {
      "organization": null,
      "role": "Ibrahim Prize for Achievement in African Leadership Recipient",
      "location": null,
      "start_date": "2018",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Awarded for ensuring Liberia's first peaceful, democratic transition of power in 73 years.",
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "A month later, she was awarded the prestigious Ibrahim Prize for Achievement in African Leadership – a prize awarded to democratically-elected African leaders who leave office at the end of their constitutionally mandated terms."
      ]
    }
  ]
}

raw_extractions.description: Established the TRC to probe corruption and heal ethnic tensions.
supporting_quotes: In addition, she established a Truth and Reconciliation Committee (TRC) in 2006 to probe corruption and heal ethnic tensions.
raw_extractions.raw_llm_output:
```json
{
  "events": [
    {
      "organization": "Truth and Reconciliation Committee (TRC)",
      "role": "Establisher",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": "2006",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Established the TRC to probe corruption and heal ethnic tensions.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["In addition, she established a Truth and Reconciliation Committee (TRC) in 2006 to probe corruption and heal ethnic tensions."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Served as President of Liberia, mentioned in TRC report for supporting warring factions early in the civil war.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Ironically, in 2009 Sirleaf was mentioned in one of the TRC’s reports, which recommended that she, along with a number of others, be banned from holding elective office for 30 years for having supported warring factions in the civil war."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Anti-Corruption Commission",
      "role": "Creator",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": "2008",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Created the Anti-Corruption Commission as part of efforts to eradicate corruption.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Efforts toward eradicating corruption—a significant problem that Sirleaf had pledged to end—included the creation of the Anti-Corruption Commission in 2008."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "Presidential Candidate",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": "2010",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Announced intent to stand in the October 2011 presidential election despite previous pledge to serve only one term.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Despite having previously pledged to serve only one term as president, in 2010 Sirleaf announced her intent to stand in the October 2011 presidential election, stating that she still had work to do."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "President",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": null,
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Challenged in court over eligibility to run for president due to residency requirements.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["A month before the election, however, Sirleaf’s eligibility was challenged in court by a small opposition group that pointed to a provision of the constitution that stated that all presidential candidates were to have resided in Liberia for 10 years prior to an election, a requirement that Sirleaf and several other candidates did not meet."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Nobel Committee",
      "role": "Nobel Peace Prize Winner",
      "location": "International",
      "start_date": "2011",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize days before the 2011 presidential election.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["Additional preelection controversy was generated when Sirleaf won the Nobel Peace Prize mere days before the poll."]
    },
    {
      "organization": "Government of Liberia",
      "role": "Presidential Candidate",
      "location": "Liberia",
      "start_date": "2011",
      "end_date": null,
      "description": "Top vote getter in the October 11, 2011, election with more than 43 percent of the vote.",
      "supporting_quotes": ["More than a dozen candidates stood in the October 11, 2011, election. Sirleaf was the top vote getter, with more than 43 percent of the vote, followed by Winston Tubman—running with Weah as his vice presidential candidate—who garnered about 32 percent."]
    }
  ]
}
```
